    • getSkills

    • getTeamWithSkillSet

      public Result getTeamWithSkillSet(int minNumberOfEmployees, int maxNumberOfEmployees, List<Skill> skillSet, Team teamEmployees)
      Attempts to assemble a team of employees based on the specified skill requirements and constraints on the minimum and maximum number of team members.

      This method searches for employees who can fulfill the required skills and tries to form a team that meets the specified size constraints. It processes each suitable employee and adjusts the remaining skill needs accordingly. The team is considered valid if it contains at least the minimum number of employees required and does not exceed the maximum limit, while also covering all the specified skills.

      Parameters:
      minNumberOfEmployees - The minimum number of employees required in the team.
      maxNumberOfEmployees - The maximum number of employees that the team can have.
      skillSet - A list of Skill objects representing the skills required for the team.
      teamEmployees - An instance of Team where the selected employees will be added.
      Returns:
      A Result object containing the outcome of the team generation process. The Result includes a success flag and a message indicating the outcome. If the team cannot be formed due to insufficient employees, exceeding size limits, or unmet skill requirements, the result will indicate failure with an appropriate message. If no employees are available to form a team, this will also result in a failure message.

    • createTeam

      public Optional<Team> createTeam(Team teamEmployees)
      Creates a new team based on the given team details and adds it to the repository. This method copies the employees from the provided team object into a new team instance, and then attempts to add this new team to the repository. The success of the operation depends on the repository's behavior and constraints.
      Parameters:
      teamEmployees - The Team object containing the list of employees to be included in the new team. The team should have its employees properly initialized. This parameter should not be null.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the newly created team if the operation was successful, or an empty Optional if the addition to the repository failed for any reason.

    • getEmployeesNotInTeam

      public List<Employee> getEmployeesNotInTeam(Team teamList)
      Retrieves a list of employees who are not currently part of the specified team. This method queries all available employees and filters out those who are already members of the team provided as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      teamList - The team whose non-members are to be determined. This parameter should not be null.
      Returns:
      A list of Employee objects representing employees not in the specified team. The list will be empty if all employees are part of the team or if there are no employees to check.

    • printAllTeams

      public void printAllTeams()
